messageBody:
Hi,

I need help with doing a particular thing in JUnit. Any help would be
highly appreciated.

I am using Junit to test a big application. The application has
several modules that further have specific APIs. To test the whole
application  I have a scenario in which I use a class for each
module. This class inherits the TestCase Class of Junit framework and
contains test methods wherein each method corresponds to an API of the
module. (I hope all this doesn't sound too confusing).

Now I need the flexibility of testing only some particular APIs, i.e.,
I need to call only certain test methods from the class that inherits
the TestCase class. Is there a functionality in Junit that can enable
me to do that? I know I can add test cases to a suit but is there a
functionality to add particular test methods to the Test case?

I am explaining this with an example here in case it is still not clear 

Big application
Module1
API1
API2
Module2
API1
API2

BigTestSuite (inherits junit.TestSuite)
Module1TestCase (class that inherits junit.TestCase)
testAPI1()
testAPI2()
Module2TestCase (class that inherits junit.TestCase)
testAPI1()
testAPI2()

Now I need a functionality wherein when I run the test suite  I can
dynamically run testAPI1() to Module1TestCase if it is required to run
only this test OR I could run testAPI2() and testAPI1() both if that
is required. I cannot hard-code this anywhere.

Can I somehow do this in Junit?

Please help!
Thanks
